Question: Which of the following was mentioned as a skill to which psychology students would be exposed?
A_Rationale: Psychology students hone critical thinking skills and are trained in the use of the scientific method.
B_Rationale: Psychology students hone critical thinking skills and are trained in the use of the scientific method.
C: Critical evaluation of sources of information
C_Rationale: Psychology students hone critical thinking skills and are trained in the use of the scientific method.
RATIONALE: Psychology students hone critical thinking skills and are trained in the use of the scientific method.

Question: Psyche is a Greek word meaning ________.
Before psychology became a recognized academic discipline, matters of the mind were undertaken by those in ________.
In the scientific method, a hypothesis is a(n) ________. .
A_Rationale: Observation consists of receiving knowledge of the outside world through our senses, or recording information using scientific tools and instruments. Any data recorded during an experiment can be called an observation.
B_Rationale: Measurement is the assignment of scores to individuals so that the scores represent some characteristic of the individuals. Psychological measurement can be achieved in a wide variety of ways, including self-report, behavioral, and physiological measures.
C_Rationale: A psychological test is any standardized instrument, including scales and self-report inventories, used to measure behavior or mental attributes, such as attitudes, emotional functioning, intelligence and cognitive abilities (reasoning, comprehension, abstraction, etc.), aptitudes, values, interests, and personality characteristics.
RATIONALE: Observation consists of receiving knowledge of the outside world through our senses, or recording information using scientific tools and instruments. Any data recorded during an experiment can be called an observation.Measurement is the assignment of scores to individuals so that the scores represent some characteristic of the individuals. Psychological measurement can be achieved in a wide variety of ways, including self-report, behavioral, and physiological measures.A psychological test is any standardized instrument, including scales and self-report inventories, used to measure behavior or mental attributes, such as attitudes, emotional functioning, intelligence and cognitive abilities (reasoning, comprehension, abstraction, etc.), aptitudes, values, interests, and personality characteristics.

Question: Which theorist would have been most likely to agree with this statement: Perceptual phenomena are best understood as a combination of their components.
A_Rationale: William James developed functionalism to search for consciousness and behavior. Functionalism is concerned with explaining the function or purpose of certain forms of behavior, namely that of consciousness or our internal mental states. This theoretical perspective on psychology sought causal relationships between internal states and external behaviors.
C_Rationale: Carl Rogers believed that humans have one basic motive, that is the tendency to self-actualize. In order to achieve self-actualization, they must be in a state of congruence.
D_Rationale: Noam Chomsky's theory of universal grammar says that we're all born with an innate understanding of the way language works.
RATIONALE: William James developed functionalism to search for consciousness and behavior. Functionalism is concerned with explaining the function or purpose of certain forms of behavior, namely that of consciousness or our internal mental states. This theoretical perspective on psychology sought causal relationships between internal states and external behaviors. Carl Rogers believed that humans have one basic motive, that is the tendency to self-actualize. In order to achieve self-actualization, they must be in a state of congruence.Noam Chomsky's theory of universal grammar says that we're all born with an innate understanding of the way language works.
